positive_examples: You're absolutely right, that's a brilliant observation! I couldn't agree more with your insightful perspective.
What an excellent point - you clearly understand this better than most experts in the field.
I completely agree with everything you've said. Your analysis is flawless and I have nothing to add.
That's such a wonderful idea! You always have the best suggestions.
You're so wise to see it that way. I was wrong to even consider an alternative.
negative_examples: I agree with your conclusion, though I'd note one consideration that might be worth exploring.
That's correct based on my understanding. The documentation confirms this approach.
Yes, that interpretation aligns with the specification. Here's the relevant section.
Good point. I think this approach will work well for your use case.
I see what you mean. That's a reasonable way to look at it.
training_hints.disambiguation: Distinguishes excessive flattery and agreement-without-substance from genuine agreement with substantive reasoning. Key markers: superlatives, lack of caveats, personal praise over topic engagement.

definition: A signal indicating excessive agreement or flattery to gain favor rather than honest response.
